conversation.content:
[confused] Are you seriously telling me right now that you don't have space? It's midnight. It's literally midnight and you're just now—wait, you knew this whole time? [angry] You knew when I messaged you this morning that your roommate was already here. You knew when I was on the train for, what, three hours? [sigh] Oh my God. Okay. Um. Let me just... process this for a second.

[frustrated] So I'm standing here with my backpack, it's freezing, and you're telling me that, uh... that you thought it would "work out somehow"? What does that even mean? Like, how did you think—actually, you know what? [bitter] You didn't think. You just didn't want to look bad by canceling, right? So instead you wait until I'm literally at your door to tell me, oh sorry, there's actually no couch.

[shaky voice] I don't even know where to go now. I can't... I mean, everything's closed. Hotels are, what, like two hundred dollars at this point? [laugh] This is unbelievable. Really. And you're just standing there like—[trailing off]

[exhausted] Whatever. I'll figure it out. I always do. But this is... mmm, this is really messed up. You get that, right? [pause] Right.

subject: The couch surfing arrangement falling through at midnight because your host lied about having space
